it.polimi.ingsw.GC_32.Server.Network

Class RMIServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.ingsw.GC_32.Server.Network.RMIServer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    RMIConnection, java.rmi.Remote

    public class RMIServer
extends java.lang.Object
implements RMIConnection
    perform all the function linked to the RMI connections management. In particular open, close the RMI connection with the client and allow to send and recive messages
    • rmiQueue: ConcurrentHashMap which associate each player connected thoroght RMI to a queue of messages used by the server to send message to the client
    See Also:
    RMIConnection

      the constructor setup the server to accept RMI connections

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close(java.util.UUID id)
      close the TMI connection with this player
      java.lang.String getMessage(java.util.UUID id)
      allow to get message from the server, looking into the relative message queue retrived by rmiQueue
      boolean hadMessage(java.util.UUID id)
      allow the client to know if there are messages available for him.
      java.util.UUID open()
      open the RMI connection with a player. when a new client connects with the server call this method which will instantiate a new player object and will register it into the GameRegistry, specifing the connection mode.
      void sendMessage(java.util.UUID id, java.lang.String message)
      allow to send message to the server. when the client wants send a message, he will simply call this method which will build a GameMessage and finally will insert it into the MessageManager queue

    • Constructor Detail

      • RMIServer

        public RMIServer(java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap<java.util.UUID,java.util.concurrent.LinkedBlockingQueue<java.lang.String>> queue)
          throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        the constructor setup the server to accept RMI connections
        Parameters:
        queue - the queue into which the clients will be registered
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

    • Method Detail

      • open

        public java.util.UUID open()
                    throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        open the RMI connection with a player. when a new client connects with the server call this method which will instantiate a new player object and will register it into the GameRegistry, specifing the connection mode. Finally open() associate the player (with his UUID) to the corresponing message queue. A CONNEST message is sent as well.
        Specified by:
        open in interface RMIConnection
        Returns:
        the UUID of the client just connected
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • close

        public void close(java.util.UUID id)
           throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        close the TMI connection with this player
        Specified by:
        close in interface RMIConnection
        Parameters:
        id - the UUID of the player which has closed the connection
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • sendMessage

        public void sendMessage(java.util.UUID id,
                        java.lang.String message)
                 throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        allow to send message to the server. when the client wants send a message, he will simply call this method which will build a GameMessage and finally will insert it into the MessageManager queue
        Specified by:
        sendMessage in interface RMIConnection
        Parameters:
        id - the UUID of the client who has sent the message
        message - the message to send
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • getMessage

        public java.lang.String getMessage(java.util.UUID id)
                            throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        allow to get message from the server, looking into the relative message queue retrived by rmiQueue
        Specified by:
        getMessage in interface RMIConnection
        Parameters:
        id - the UUID of the player who wants get messages
        Returns:
        the message sent by the server
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • hadMessage

        public boolean hadMessage(java.util.UUID id)
                   throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        allow the client to know if there are messages available for him.
        Specified by:
        hadMessage in interface RMIConnection
        Parameters:
        id - the UUID of the player who wants get messages
        Returns:
        true if the message queue has some message for the client, false if not
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException
